POR.DRECONTENT:
Outcomes of grant DMS-1102548 include the following publications and preprints with new collaborators 

- Kenneth Chan (University of Washington), 

- Pavel Etingof (Massachusetts Institute of Technology), 

- Ellen Kirkman (Wake Forest University), 

- Susan Sierra (University of Edinburgh), 

- Yanhua Wang (Shanghai University of Finance and Economics), 

- Sarah Witherspoon (Texas A&M University), and 

- James Zhang (University of Washington):


P. Etingof and C. Walton, Pointed Hopf actions on fields, I, arXiv.org/abs/1403.4673, submitted.

C. Walton and S. Witherspoon, Poincare-Birkhoff-Witt deformations of smash product algebras from Hopf actions on Koszul algebras, arXiv.org/abs/1308.6011, submitted.

K. Chan, E. Kirkman, C. Walton, and J. J. Zhang,  Quantum binary polyhedral groups and their actions on quantum planes, arXiv.org/abs/1303.7203, to appear in J. Reine Angew. Math.

S. J. Sierra and C. Walton, The universal enveloping algebra of the Witt algebra is not noetherian, Adv. Math. 262 (2014), pp. 239-260.

K. Chan, C. Walton, and J. J. Zhang,  Hopf actions and Nakayama automorphisms, J. Algebra 409 (2014), pp. 26-53. 

P. Etingof and C. Walton, Semisimple Hopf actions on commutative domains, Adv. Math. 251C (2014), pp. 47-61.

K. Chan, C. Walton, Y. Wang, and J. J. Zhang,  Hopf actions on filtered regular algebras, J. Algebra (1) 397 (2014), pp. 68-90.

C. Walton, Representation theory of three-dimensional Sklyanin algebras, Nuclear Physics (1) 860 (2012), pp. 167-185.

 


This funding was also used for attendance at various conferences, workshops, and programs including:

Interactions between Algebraic Geometry and Noncommutative Algebra Workshop, Mathematisches Forschungsinstitut Oberwolfach, Oberwolfach, Germany, May 2014.

Infinite dimensional Hopf algebras Mini-Workshop, Mathematisches Forschungsinstitut Oberwolfach, Oberwolfach, Germany, April 2014.

Noncommutative Invariant Theory workshop, University of Washington, Seattle, Washington,  May 2012 and March 2014.

Canadian Mathematical Society section meeting, University of  Ottawa, Ottawa, Canada, December 2013.

Noncommutative Algebraic Geometry and Representation Theory program, Mathematical Sciences Research Institute, Berkeley, California, January - May 2013.

New Trends in Noncommutative Algebra and Algebraic Geometry,Banff International Research Station, Banff, Canada, October 2012.

Noncommutative Algebraic Geometry and D-branes workshop,Simons Center for Geometry and Physics, Stony Brook, New York,   December 2011.

 

The PI also participated as program coordinator of the MIT PRIMES Circle program (since August 2012) and as an instructor for the Enhancing Diversity in Graduate Education (EDGE) program at:

- Harvey Mudd College, Claremont, California, June 2014.

- New College of Florida, Sarasota, Florida,  June 2013.

- Pomona College, Claremont, California, June 2012.
